name: Kyushu J7W1
description: Building the Kyūshū J7W Shinden 震電, as used by Kōichi Shikishima in Godzilla Minus One to deliver the final fatal blow. No electronics in this one.

name: Mitsubishi G3M3 Nell
description: Building the Mitsubishi G3M3 Nell from Hasegawa in 1:72, motorized and mounted in-flight for the #risingsungb.

name: Gloster Meteor FR.9
description: Building the 1:72 Airfix 2022 tooling of the Gloster Meteor FR.9. No electronics in this one.

name: Mitsubishi A6M2b
description: Building the classic Tamiya 1:72 A6M2b

name: IJN Seaplane Tender Kamikawa Maru
description: Depicting the brief establishment of a seaplane base at Deboyne in 1942 by the IJN Seaplane Tender Kamikawa Maru and a supporting force.

name: IJN Cruiser Jintsū
description: Building the Fujimi 1:700 kit of the IJN Cruiser Jintsū (神通) (じんつう)

name: Hawker Typhoon Mk.Ib on D-Day
description: Typhoon Ib on ground attack over France 1944. Just a quick build of the nice little Airfix 1:72 kit while other projects drag along on the bench!

name: Type 97 ChiHa in Malaya
description: A Type 97 Chi-Ha チハ roaring down the Malayan peninsula in 1941. This is the old Airfix 1:76 kit with a couple of infantry figures, echoing a pretty well-known picture. No electronics in this one.

name: Spitfire PR Mk.XIX
description: Building the Supermarine Spitfire PR.XIX in 1:72 from the Airfix D-Day Duo kit. No electronics in this one.

name: Betio
description: Type 95 Ha-Gō on Betio, capturing the aftermath of the battle as depicted in a famous photograph. Uses the IBG Models 1:72 kit. No electronics.

name: I-16 Escuadrilla de Mosca
description: Building the beautiful ClearProp 1:72 rendering of the Polikarpov I-16 in Spanish Republican Air Force service in the Escuadrilla de Mosca. No electronics.

name: British Royal Artillery Gunner 1815
description: Posing the Elan13 54mm Royal Artillery Gunner leaping into action... (no electronics in this one)

name: Hongdu K-8/JL-8
description: Building the Hongdu K-8/JL-8 trainer aircraft from the Trumpeter 1:72 kit. No electronics in this one.

name: キ51 over Burma 1942
description: Building the ClearProp Ki-51 Sonia 1:144 with a motorized prop and a camo scheme as used in Burma 1942

name: Kawasaki Ki-100-I-Otsu
description: Building the キ100 from Aoshima in 1:72, mounted in flight over a watercolour scene. No electronics in this one.

name: M.V. Southland Star
description: Blue Star Lines M.V. Southland Star transiting Cook Strait in a gale

name: Morane Saulnier MS.230
description: Building the Dora Wings Morane Saulnier MS.230 for the 2024 Models for Heroes 48x48 group build.

name: Gloster Gladiator
description: Building the Airfix 1:72 Gloster Gladiator Mk II over St. Inglevert, Northern France, December 1939. No electronics in this one.

name: Bristol Bulldog
description: The Bristol Bulldog is an RAF classic from the inter-war period. Although this Airfix Vintage Classic 2019 boxing was tooled way back in 1969, it is still a very buildable kit of a very beautiful plane.

name: IJN Heavy Cruiser Tone 利根
description: On 23 January 1942, the IJN Heavy Cruiser Tone 利根 attacked Buka Island with its float planes. A diorama featuring the Aoshima 1:700 kit.

name: CR.714
description: Building the DoraWings Caudron-Renault CR.714 with a little Christmas Spirit. No electronics in this one.

name: Electra And Express To the Rescue
description: HMS Electra (H27) and HMS Express (H61) race to protect HMS Prince of Wales and HMS Repulse as a wave of G3M Nell torpedo bombers press their attack on 10 December 1941. No electronics in this one.

name: Kawasaki Ki-10
description: Building the ICM Kawasaki Ki-10. No electronics in this one.

name: Hurricane MkI
description: No. 501 Squadron RAF over Dover in August 1940. Depicted with the Arma Hobby 1:72 kit and a Pit-Road 1:700 wingmen. No electronics in this one.

name: Nakajima Ki43-II
description: Nakajima Ki-43 Hayabusa (隼), doing what peregrine falcons do best. the Hasegawa 1:72 kit paired with a Pit-Road B-17, pictures somewhere over New Guinea in 1943.

name: DHC Beaver
description: Building the de Havilland Canada DHC-2 Beaver in-flight and motorized, based on the Airfix Vintage Classics kit A03017V.

name: Nakajima Ki-27
description: Building the ICM Nakajima Ki-27a kit in 1:72 scale (no electronics in this one)

name: YANMAR Rice Harvester YH6115 オートコンバイン
description: Building the Hasegawa 1:35 kit of the YANMAR YH6115 Rice Harvester, and spending a lot of time watching youtube videos of the machine while *planting rice* in a dio! (no electronics in this one)

name: Honda Super Cub
description: Building the F-Toys Honda Super Cub in 1:24

name: Mitsubishi A6M2-N
description: Building the F-Toys Mitsubishi A6M2-N from their 1/144 WORK SHOP Vol.40

name: Kawasaki Ki-61-II
description: Building the F-Toys Ki-61-II from Wing Kit Collection 18 in 1:144

name: HIDF Twin Otter Recon/SpecOps
description: DHC-6 Twin Otter from Revell (04901 in 1:72), as seen commandeered by HIDF Gendarmerie and pressed into service as a reconnaissance and special ops platform. For the Micro Machines Podcast HIDF GB.
categories: scale models, Craft, LED, 555 Timer, motor, Oscillators

name: Defiant v Do-17z
description: Aces High! A Boulton Paul Defiant Mk.I bringing down a Dornier Do-17z 'flying pencil', built with the Airfix 1:72 kits from 2014. No electronics.

name: Ukrainian Su-24M Fencer
description: Building the Armory 1:144 representation of the Ukrainian Su-24M Fencer. No electronics in this one.

name: IJN Military Transports
description: Building the No.1 and No.101 landing ships 輸送艦 from the Tamiya Military Transport set. No electronics or base for this - saving for a future diorama.

name: Snowy Finds a Ride
description: My Hergé fanfic for the @justmakingconversation Great Tarp Build featuring the Dora Wings Percival Proctor & Vega Gull in 1:72 (no electronics in this one)

name: Ukraine's Maritime Drone (USV)
description: Building the MikroMir 1:35 kit. No electronics in this one.

name: Aérospatiale SA365N Dauphin 2
description: Building the Aérospatiale SA365N Dauphin 2 as used by the Tokyo Metropolitan Police Department. Trumpeter 1:48 kit, no electronics.

name: IJA Type 89 I-Go Otsu Medium Tank
description: Building the IBG Models 1:72 representation of the IJA Type 89 I-Go Otsu Medium Tank. No electronics in this one.

name: F-4EJ Last Phantom
description: Building the 2019 commemorative scheme of the JASDF F-4EJ Kai Phantom II - a beautiful little Platz 1:144 kit. No electronics in this one.

name: Race To Jitra
description: Building a double-sided box diorama in mixed scales to capture the rapid advance of Japanese forces during the Invasion of Malaya. The Battle of Jitra was one of many engagements where the advancing force overwhelmed the under-prepared defenders on the peninsula.

name: IJA Type 95 Ha-Go Light Tank
description: Building the IBG Models 1:72 representation of the IJA Type 95 Ha-Gō ハ号 Light Tank. No electronics in this one.

name: The Legendary T-34/85 215号
description: Capturing the legendary T-34/85 215号 in action, using the Rye Field Model kit RM-5059 in 1:35 and some great resin figures from YUFAN Model. No electronics in this one.

name: Bayraktar TB2
description: Building the Clear Prop! 1:48 representation of the now iconic Bayraktar TB2 as used by the Armed Forces of Ukraine

name: IJN Destroyer Ayanami
description: Building the Tamiya 1:700 representation of the IJN Destroyer Ayanami 綾波

name: Nakajima Ki84
description: Building the Arma Hobby 1:72 representation of the Nakajima Ki-84 Hayate (キ84 疾風)

name: IJN Hashidate
description: Building the Tamiya 1:700 kit of the IJN Gunboat Hashidate 橋立

name: Mitsubishi A6M Zero on the Zuikaku
description: Building the amazing little Sweet 1:144 kit of the Zero with Flight Deck

name: Austin Tilly 10HP
description: Buidling a fantastic little 1:72 Austin Tilly 10hp from ACE Models of Ukraine. No electronics in this one - just a quick weekend build.

name: Nakajima Ki-84 Egg-Scale
description: An egg-scale warm up before I move on to the Arma Hobby Ki-84 Hayate

name: Gloster Pioneer E.28-39
description: Building the Gloster Pioneer E.28-39 from Clear Prop models of Ukraine

name: Bellanca CH-300 Pacemaker
description: Building the Dora Wings kit of the Bellanca CH-300 Pacemaker with an appropriately? kitsch presentation: Inter Island Airways livery over the beaches of Hawaii.

name: Mitsubishi A5M2b
description: Building the Wingsy Kits A5M2b in-flight for the 2023 Model Officers Mess birthday bash raising money and awareness for the Models for Heroes charity.

name: Teddy Bear Viking
description: If you go down in the woods today, you're sure of a big surprise ... a Teddy Bear Viking in a Walnut!

name: Porco Rosso
description: Revisiting one of my favourite films after so many years thanks to a wonderful 1:72 kit of the Porco Rosso Savoia S.21 from Fine Molds

name: de Havilland Mosquito B Mk.XVI
description: Building the Airfix de Havilland Mosquito B Mk.XVI (no electronics)

name: U.N.C.F. Dreadnoughts
description: Electrifying a pair of Bandai Spirits Dreadnought-class battleships with LED effect and fibre optics

name: Mozzie Bite!
description: A little 1:700 diorama in an epoxy resin paper-weight featuring Pit-Road Mosquito and Tiger I models (no electronics).

name: Westland Whirlwind HAS.22
description: Building the Westland Whirlwind HAS.22 from Airfix (no electronics in this one)

name: Blériot XI
description: Making a Blériot XI keeper of the spare keys - an Aerobase kit from Japan encased in epoxy resin (no electronics).

name: Yawatamaru / Un'yō
description: Using a Pepper's Ghost effect in a box diorama to capture the Yawatamaru (八幡丸) conversion to Taiyō-class escort carrier Un'yō (雲鷹).

name: In Spring
description: Perhaps my final build for 2022. Fittingly, figures from MasterBox of Ukraine, in a diorama that attempts to capture my greatest hope for what will come in the new year.. (no electronics)

name: wz. 34
description: Building the Polish Samochód pancerny wz. 34 from the 1:35 Mirage Hobby kit, with some figures from MiniArt: The Lost Christmas

name: Empire in Decay - Victor III
description: A Soviet Victor III tied up to a wharf and left to decay in the toxic sludge ... modelled from the Dragon 1:700 kit (no electronics in this one)

name: J-20
description: Building the Trumpeter 1:144 kit of the Chengdu J-20 fifth-generation fighter of the PLAAF (no electronics here, just a great little kit)

name: Mitsubishi Ki-46 Trainer
description: Building a SG$5 bargain ARII 1:72 kit of the Mitsubishi Ki-46-II Dinah Trainer (no electronics)

name: PLAN Type 051C
description: Building the PLAN Type 051C destroyer DDG 115 沈阳 (Shenyang) with a little LED illumination.

name: Axis Of Chess
description: Welcome to Axis of Chess, my little excuse for using up a bunch of spare Pit-Road 1:700 vehicles. No electronics in this one.

name: ORP Ślązak
description: Building the ORP Ślązak Hunt-class destroyer in 1:700 scale in a Baltic Winter Patrol setting. My first venture into IBG ship kits - no electronics here, just a very fine kit experience.

name: Tachikawa KKY-1
description: Building the rare Tachikawa KKY1 from Ukrainian model company Amodel. No electronics in this one.

name: Concorde
description: Last flight of the Concorde - the Airfix 1:114 with LED effects in 1970s travel-agent chic

name: WarHawk 40K
description: Taking the Airfix 1:72 Curtiss Warhawk in a slightly unusual direction, with LED effects driven by a CD4060 ripple counter

name: Stridsvagn 103
description: Practicing some hull-down diorama effects with the Swedish Stridsvagn 103 using the Trumpeter 1:72 kit (no electronics)

name: CA-19 Boomerang
description: Building the Special Hobby 1:72 RAAF CA-19 Boomerang, as stationed in New Britain 1945 (no electronics)

name: Flying Tigers Egg-Scale
description: Building the Tiger Model egg-scale P-40 so it can join its 1:72 and 1:144 Brothers in Arms (no electronics in this one)

name: HMS Revenge
description: HMS Revenge heading out from Faslane on patrol - an attempt at capturing the distinctive wake of a sub cruising on the surface. Dragon 1:700 kit.

name: IJN No.13 Sub-chaser
description: IJN No.13 class submarine chaser 第十三号型駆潜艇 on a quiet island patrol

name: Daihatsu Midget
description: Building the iconic 1957 Daihatsu Midget DMK from a Micro Ace/Arii kit with some scratch modifications. No electronics in this one.

name: TS-11 Iskra
description: Building the beautiful Arma Hobby 1:72 PZL TS-11 Iskra. No electronics in this one, just enjoying the build.

name: Mongol Warriors
description: Using select 1:72 figures from HäT set 8298 to make a little diorama in an Ikea picture frame with LED lighting

name: P-40B Flying Tiger in 1:144
description: Improving the already well-detailed 1:144 AFV Club Flying Tigers P-40B with a scratch built cockpit (no electronics in this one)

name: P-40B Flying Tiger in 1:72
description: Building the most excellent Airfix P-40B H81-A2 1:72 in Flying Tigers livery (no electronics in this one)

name: Fairey Gannet
description: Building the most beautifully ugly Fairey Gannet from the Trumpeter 1:72 kit (no electronics in this one)

name: Tachikawa Ki-55
description: Building a SG$5 bargain Fujimi 1:72 kit of the Tachikawa Ki-55 Type 99 Advanced Trainer (no electronics in this one)

name: Ukrainian Cossack
description: An heroic pose in a walnut with a figure from the Orion Ukrainian Mounted Cossacks set. No, this is not  meant to be political - but if you come and try to steal my nuts, expect to fight this guy! (no electronics in this one)

name: Fubuki
description: Building the Japanese destroyer Fubuki (吹雪, 1927) from a beautifully detailed 1:700 Yamashita Hobby kit with Tetra Model Works PE

name: HMS Sheffield
description: Reproducing a famous photograph of the fire-fighting efforts aboard the HMS Sheffield after is was hit by an Exocet on 4 May 1982

name: Spitfire Mk.XIV
description: Building the beautiful candy red G-Fire Spitfire Mk.XIV from Airfix in 1:48 scale. No electronics in this one.

name: Man Overboard
description: A little 1:700 diorama in a walnut featuring a little drama while mooring a Mitsubishi F1M2 observation seaplane. Part of the Just Making Conversation podcast Walnut Challenge group build. No electronics in this one.

name: Nakajima B5N2 Kate
description: Building the Airfix 1:72 Nakajima B5N2 Kate - an exercise in weathering, no electronics.

name: Spitfire Mk.Vc
description: Building a diorama inspired by the box-art of Airfix's 1:72 scale Spitfire Mk.Vc flying over La Sénia Algeria 1942, enhanced with some LED candle effects and targets of opportunity.

name: Westland Lynx
description: Building the Royal Navy Westland Lynx HAS.3 from HobbyBoss (no electronics in this one)

name: Vauxhall D-Type Ambulance
description: Building the wonderful little 1:72 Vauxhall D-Type Ambulance kit from Ukrainian manufacturer Roden. Dedicated to the memory of Valery Grygorenko. Valery created some of the most amazing box art for Roden but tragically he was killed in a Russian attack near his home in March 2022.

name: Blackburn Buccaneer S.2C
description: An excuse to build another sea base - this time for an aircraft - the RN Blackburn Buccaneer S.2C from Airfix in 1:72 scale, tooling around the North Sea at 30ft.

name: Wirraway
description: Building the Special Hobby 1:72 CAC Wirraway, as stationed at Seletar in 1941 - just up the road from me (no electronics)

name: T34 1942
description: Building the Trumpeter 1:72 T-34 Model 1942 with some CMK figures (no electronics - just practicing weathering at small scale)

name: KubelMagic
description: A walnut, Brengun 1:144 Kübelwagen and a miniaturised SMD version of a BJT oscillator - and with a bit of practice, some close-up model magic.

name: Chengdu J-10S
description: Building the Trumpeter 1:72 Chengdu J-10S in early Ba Yi Aerobatics Team colours. No electronics in this one.

name: I-153
description: Building the Polikarpov I-153 as used by the Guomindang Air Force - ICM 1:72 kit 72076

name: HMS Prince Of Wales
description: Remembering Force Z with a build of the HMS Prince Of Wales from the Tamiya 1:700 waterline series. No electronics for this one.

name: Tornado ECR
description: Building the 1:144 Tornado ECR from Revell with wireless LEDs in the Tailpipe.

name: That is not a toy, my boy!
description: A somewhat unconventional diorama featuring an Airfix 1:35 M7 Priest, some MasterBox figures and a bonsai tree!

name: JF-17
description: Buidling the JF-17 Thunder with the striking livery it sported during the 2007 Pakistan Day Joint Services Parade. No electronics in this one.

name: PZL P.7a
description: Building the Arma Hobby PZL P.7a 1:72 expert set.  No electronics added - just enjoying this wonderfully detailed kit.

name: Firefly
description: Practicing finishing techniques on the Airfix 1:72 Sherman Firefly, then animating the turret with some ATtiny85 magic
categories: scale models, Craft, Arduino, AVR, Sensor, OpAmp, Servo, AFV

name: HMAS Vampire
description: Remembering Force Z with a build of the HMAS Vampire from the Tamiya 1:700 waterline series. No electronics for this one.

name: The Red Eyed Space Marine
description: Inspired by all the mad miniature skills out there these days, I delve into the world of space marines with eyes that glow - no wires or batteries

name: Kawanishi K5Y1 Tensegrity Stand
description: Experimenting with tensegrity model mounting, using as a subject the ARII 1:72 Kawanishi K5Y1 赤とんぼ (Willow)

name: I-16 and I-58
description: Building the Tamiya 1:700 I-16 and I-58 waterline kit 31453. No electronics in this one - more an experiment in rust and water effects.

name: 25 Pounder Field Gun and Quad
description: Building the Airfix 1:76 scale 25 Pounder Field Gun and Quad A01305. No electronics in this one yet.

name: Tydirium Strobe Module
description: Packaging the ATtiny85 Lambda-class shuttle Tydirium navigation strobe circuit as a small board that can be added to an existing lighting setup.

name: Tiger Moth
description: Royal Navy Fleet Air Arm Tiger Moth XL717 heading out over the rocky shors near Abbotsinch, Scotland - a small vignette featuring the Airfix De Havilland DH.82a Tiger Moth 1:72 A02106 with a custom motorised propeller

name: Tydirium Strobe
description: Figuring out the navigation light strobe frequency of the Lambda-class shuttle Tydirium and building a freeform circuit sculpture to demonstrate the effects (running an ATtiny85 on 3V)
categories: Arduino, ATmel, LED, Circuit Sculpture, Freeform

name: Nanchang Y-5
description: A simple build of the Antonov An-2 Colt/Nanchang Y-5 1:72 model 01602 from Trumpeter. I've spied opportunities for electronics in this kit but not added any yet.

name: Schnellboot
description: Building the Bronco NB5004 1/350 German S-100 Class Schnellboot with a dockside diorama with LED effects

name: PLA Navy Type 054A
description: Building the Trumpeter 1:700 PLAN 054A Frigate (no electronics - yet)

name: RWD-8 DWL
description: A simple build of the RWD-8 DWL Polish trainer 1:72 kit 72502 from IBG Models (no electronics - yet)

name: Jie Fang CA-30 Fuel Truck
description: A simple build of the 解放 Jie Fang CA-30 Fuel Transporter 1:72 model 01104 from Trumpeter (no electronics - yet).

name: Hawker Typhoon
description: Building the Airfix 1:72 Hawker Typhoon Mk.Ib, electrifying it with an engine and rocket effects and displaying it with a ground attack vignette

name: 屋台ラーメン The Yatai Ramen Doorbell
description: A wireless doorbell based on an Arii (Microace) Yatai Ramen model with added lights and sound

name: Hurst Point Lighthouse
description: Building the wonderful Paper Shipwright model of the historic Hurst Point Lighthouse, and bringing it to life with a Fl(4) W 15s LED array

name: Harrier GR.1
description: Building the Airfix 1:72 Hawker Siddeley Harrier GR.1, electrifying it with lights and engine sounds and putting it in a cold war forward deployment diorama (somewhere in a German forest circa 1970)

name: Freeform Popsicle Airways
description: Demonstrating a simple aircraft navigation beacon sequence implemented with a couple of 555 timers

name: Pollen8
description: a freeform wire sculpture with LEDs driven by a light-sensitive 555/4017 counter circuit
categories: LED, CMOS/TTL, 555 Timer, Craft, Circuit Sculpture, Freeform

name: GoldenHind
description: building a mini metal model of the Golden Hind

name: WyLed
description: .. when you allow an exploration of a chip (TM1638) to get a little out of hand! The WyLed free-form sculpture reacts to sound and blinks a 4-digit LED display. An ATTiny85 provides a little brain, and the TM1638 handles all input and output.
categories: Arduino, ATmel, LED, TM1638, Circuit Sculpture, Freeform

name: GlowBall
description: building LED effects for a Glass Eye Studio Celestial Planet Weight

name: Sagrada Família
description: a paper model with some LED effects

name: Metal Earth Lead Guitar
description: Pimping up the Metal Earth Electric Lead Guitar kit with some sound activated LEDs with electronics squirreled away in an 'amp'
